member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.KnownSmartCardAppletIds
member.summary: A class that represents a selection of known smartcard applet IDs; exposing them via its properties.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.KnownSmartCardAppletIds.PaymentSystemEnvironment
member.summary: Gets the applet ID of the payment system environment (PSE) application.
member.returns: An IBuffer containing the PSE applet ID.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.KnownSmartCardAppletIds.ProximityPaymentSystemEnvironment
member.summary: Gets the applet ID of the proximity payment system environment (PPSE) application.
member.returns: An IBuffer containing the PPSE applet ID.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardActivationPolicyChangeResult
member.summary: Defines the return values for the RequestActivationPolicyChangeAsync method.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardActivationPolicyChangeResult.Allowed
member.summary: The policy change was allowed.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardActivationPolicyChangeResult.Denied
member.summary: The policy change was not allowed.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup
member.summary: A class that represents a digitized card, which may either be self-managed (Host Card Emulation) or backed by a physical embedded secure element (eSE). This class can also be thought of as defining a collection of smart card applet IDs.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SmartCardAppletIdGroup class.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.#ctor(System.String,Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVector{Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer},Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationCategory,Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SmartCardAppletIdGroup class using the specified parameters.
member.param: The name for this applet ID group.
The list of applet IDs.
The category of smart card to which the applet IDs apply, payment card or other.
The type of smart card to which the applet IDs apply, host card or UICC.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.AppletIds
member.summary: Gets the collection of applet IDs.
member.returns: The collection of applet IDs.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.AutomaticEnablement
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating if the operating system is permitted to enable this AppletIdGroup.
member.returns: A Boolean value indicating if the operating system is permitted to enable this AppletIdGroup.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets an extended description of a smartcard to help make it easier to identify the smartcard. You could, for example, set this to the last four digits of a credit card number.
member.returns: A string containing an extended description of a smartcard.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.DisplayName
member.summary: Sets or gets the name of this applet ID group.
member.returns: The name of this applet ID group.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.Logo
member.summary: Gets or sets an image that represents the smartcard. This might, for example, mimic the physical appearance of a credit card.
member.returns: An IRandomAccessStreamReference that provides access to a stream that contains an image that represents the smartcard.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.MaxAppletIds
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of permitted applet IDs.
member.returns: The maximum number of permitted applet IDs.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.Properties
member.summary: Gets a (generic) property bag for a smartcard.
member.returns: A ValueSet containing a (generic) property bag for a smartcard.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.SecureUserAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the smartcard requires the user to authenticate using secure biometrics before the smartcard will process a transaction (for example, the user taps their fingerprint to approve a payment). This property applies only to embedded secure element (eSE)-based applets.
member.returns: `true` if the smartcard requires the user to authenticate using secure biometrics before the smartcard will process a transaction, otherwise `false`.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.SmartCardEmulationCategory
member.summary: Sets or gets the category of smart card to which the applet IDs apply, payment card or other.
member.returns: The category of smart card to which the applet IDs apply, payment card or other.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup.SmartCardEmulationType
member.summary: Sets or gets the type of smart card to which the applet IDs apply, host card or UICC.
member.returns: The type of smart card to which the applet IDs apply, host card or UICC.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroupActivationPolicy
member.summary: Defines the valid values that can be passed to the RequestActivationPolicyChangeAsync method.

member.summary: The activation policy is set to disabled.

member.summary: The activation policy is set to enabled.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroupActivationPolicy.ForegroundOverride
member.summary: The activation policy is set to foreground override.

member.returns: Indicates if the policy change was allowed or denied.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramAlgorithm

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramAlgorithm.CbcMac
member.summary: Use the cipher block chaining message authentication code (CBC-MAC) algorithm.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramAlgorithm.Cvc3MD
member.summary: Use the CVC3-MD algorithm.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramAlgorithm.Cvc3Umd
member.summary: Use the CVC3-UMD algorithm.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramAlgorithm.DecimalizedMsd
member.summary: Use the decimalized MSD algorithm.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramAlgorithm.None
member.summary: Do not use any algorithm.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramAlgorithm.RsaPkcs1
member.summary: Use the Public-Key Cryptography Standards 1 (PKCS) RSA algorithm.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramAlgorithm.Sha1
member.summary: Use the SHA-1 algorithm.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramAlgorithm.Sha256Hmac
member.summary: Use the SHA-256 HMAC algorithm.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramAlgorithm.SignedDynamicApplicationData
member.summary: Use the signed dynamic application data algorithm.

member.summary: Generates a cryptogram storage key.

The material package name.
The material name.
A buffer that contains the confirmation challenge token. The challenge token must consist of UTF-8 characters conformating to the following C# regular expression. ```

member.summary: Gets the result of the proof of possession operation. This field is only valid if the OperationStatus field is Success.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementOptions.None
member.summary: The placement option does not have a defined format.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementOptions.UnitsAreInNibbles
member.summary: The CryptogramOffset, TemplateOffset, and CryptogramLength values are in nibbles and not bytes.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep
member.summary: Contains instructions for placing a cryptogram in an outgoing message.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep object.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.Algorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional placement step that will use this placement step's output as an input to the next specified placement step.
member.returns: The target of a chained step. The value must be null if this placement step is not chained.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.ChainedOutputStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the output of this chained step.
member.returns: The output of this chained step.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.CryptogramLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the output to take from the offset.
member.returns: The cryptogram inserted into the outgoing message may not exceed this length. Units may be either bytes or nibbles, based on the UnitsAreInNibbles flag of the CryptogramPlacementOptions property.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.CryptogramMaterialName
member.summary: Gets or sets the cryptogram material name to use when executing this step.
member.returns: The cryptogram material name to use in generating the cryptogram to be placed in this outgoing message.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.CryptogramMaterialPackageName
member.summary: Gets or sets the cryptogram material package name that contains the material specified.
member.returns: The cryptogram material package name in which the named cryptogram material may be found.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.CryptogramOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the data that will be used to generate the cryptogram to be placed in the outgoing message.
member.returns: The offset in the generated cryptogram to begin copying into the message that will be sent. Units may be either bytes or nibbles, based on the UnitsAreInNibbles flag of the CryptogramPlacementOptions field.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.CryptogramPlacementOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the cryptogram placement options.
member.returns: The cryptogram placement options.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.SourceData
member.summary: Gets or sets the data that will be encrypted in this step of chaining cryptograms.
member.returns: The source data.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.TemplateOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset into the target output buffer at which the generated cryptogram will be placed. Units may be either bytes or nibbles, based on the UnitsAreInNibbles flag of the CryptogramPlacementOptions field.
member.returns: The data template offset.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyAlgorithm
member.summary: Defines cryptogram storage key algorithms.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyAlgorithm.None
member.summary: The storage key is not encrypted.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyAlgorithm.Rsa2048
member.summary: The storage key is encrypted by RSA-2048.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyCapabilities
member.summary: Defines cryptogram storage key capabilities.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyCapabilities.HardwareProtection
member.summary: The storage key has hardware protection.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyCapabilities.None
member.summary: The storage key has none of the capabilities defined in this enumeration.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyCapabilities.UnlockPrompt
member.summary: The storage key requires a gesture prior to being used in any cryptographic operation.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyCharacteristics
member.summary: This class contains characteristics of storage keys.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyCharacteristics.

member.summary: Gets the algorithm.
member.returns: The algorithm.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyCharacteristics.Capabilities
member.summary: Gets the capabilities.
member.returns: The capabilities.

member.summary: Gets the date this storage key was created.
member.returns: The date this storage key was created.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyCharacteristics.StorageKeyName
member.summary: Gets the storage key name.
member.returns: The storage key name.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyInfo
member.summary: Contains information about the storage key so that apps can register and certify the key information with their service.

member.summary: Gets the attestation.
member.returns: A buffer containing the attestation.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyInfo.AttestationCertificateChain
member.summary: Gets the attestation certificate chain.
member.returns: A buffer containing the attestation certificate chain.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyInfo.AttestationStatus
member.summary: Gets the attestation status.
member.returns: The attestation status.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyInfo.Capabilities
member.summary: Gets the cryptogram storage key capabilities.
member.returns: The cryptogram storage key capabilities.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyInfo.OperationalRequirements
member.summary: Gets the operational requirements of the storage key.
member.returns: The operational requirements.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyInfo.OperationStatus
member.summary: Gets the operation status.
member.returns: The operation status.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyInfo.PublicKey
member.summary: Gets the public key.
member.returns: A buffer containing the public key in the format specified when calling RequestCryptogramMaterialStorageKeyInfoAsync.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyInfo.PublicKeyBlobType
member.summary: Gets the type of the public key object. This value reflects the public key blob type requested in the RequestCryptogramMaterialStorageKeyInfoAsync method.
member.returns: The type of the public key object.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus
member.summary: Defines the attestation status of a key.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.NoAttestation
member.summary: The key has no attestation.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.SoftwareKeyWithoutTpm
member.summary: The key is a software key on a device without a TPM.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.SoftwareKeyWithTpm
member.summary: The key is a software key on a device with a TPM.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.TpmKeyUnknownAttestationStatus
member.summary: The TPM supporting the key has an unknown attestation status.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.TpmKeyWithAttestation
member.summary: The key is a TPM key with attestation.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.TpmKeyWithLongTermAttestationFailure
member.summary: The key is a TPM key with a long term attestation failure.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.TpmKeyWithoutAttestationCapability
member.summary: The key is a TPM key on a device that does not have the ability to provide attestation.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.TpmKeyWithTemporaryAttestationFailure
member.summary: The key is a TPM key with a temporary attestation failure.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationCategory
member.summary: Defines the valid categories of smart cards that can be emulated.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationCategory.Other
member.summary: Specifies smart cards other than payment cards, such as a loyalty cards or security badges.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationCategory.Payment
member.summary: Specifies payment cards.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationType
member.summary: Defines the mechanism by which the device emulates a smart card.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationType.EmbeddedSE
member.summary: The device emulates a smart card by forwarding the application protocol data unit (APDU) commands to an embedded SE reader.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationType.Host
member.summary: The device emulates a smart card by forwarding application protocol data unit (APDU) commands to the host application, which responds back.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationType.Uicc
member.summary: The device emulates a smart card by forwarding the application protocol data unit (APDU) commands directly to the physical UICC card. The UICC card is more commonly referred to as the SIM card.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator
member.summary: Represents a smart card emulator device.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.EnablementPolicy
member.summary: Gets the current card emulation policy set by the user.
member.returns: The current card emulation policy set by the user through the phone settings. This property is read-only to the app; you should tell the user to change the card emulation policy in the settings on his or her phone, if their mobile operator allows it.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.MaxAppletIdGroupRegistrations
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of permitted applet ID group registrations.
member.returns: The maximum number of permitted applet ID group registrations.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.ApduReceived
member.summary: Occurs when an application protocol data unit (APDU) is received by the NFC controller.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.ConnectionDeactivated
member.summary: Occurs when the connection with the device is physically broken or when the NFC reader requests a connection to a different app.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.GetAppletIdGroupRegistrationsAsync
member.summary: Gets the registered applet identifier groups for this smart card, asynchronously.
member.returns: The registered applet identifier groups for this smart card.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.GetDefaultAsync
member.summary: Returns the SmartCardEmulator object representing the default smart card emulator device.
member.returns: After the asynchronous operation completes, returns the default smart card emulator or null if there is no smart card emulator present.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.IsHostCardEmulationSupported
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating if host card emulation is supported by this device.
member.returns: True if host card emulation is supported by this device.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.IsSupported
member.summary: Returns whether the SmartCardEmulator is supported.
member.returns: True if SmartCardEmulator is supported.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.RegisterAppletIdGroupAsync(Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup)
member.summary: Asynchronously registers a group of applet IDs.
member.param: The group of applet IDs to register.
member.returns: The group of registered applet IDs.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.Start
member.summary: Starts the smart card emulator. This method must be called from a background task.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.UnregisterAppletIdGroupAsync(Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroupRegistration)
member.summary: Asynchronously unregisters a previously registered group of applet IDs.
member.param: The previously registered group of applet IDs.
member.returns: An IAsyncAction object that is used to control the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorApduReceivedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the ApduReceived event.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorApduReceivedEventArgs.AutomaticResponseStatus
member.summary: Gets a SmartCardAutomaticResponseStatus object indicating the automatic response was already successfully sent (**Success**), attempted but failed (**UnknownError**), or was not matched with any auto-responder rule (**None**).
member.returns: The object indicating the status of the automatic response.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorApduReceivedEventArgs.CommandApdu
member.summary: Represents an application protocol data unit (APDU) command sent by an NFC reader.
member.returns: An application protocol data unit (APDU) command sent by an NFC reader.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorApduReceivedEventArgs.ConnectionProperties
member.summary: Gets the connection properties of the smart card emulator.
member.returns: The connection properties of the smart card emulator.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorApduReceivedEventArgs.State
member.summary: Gets the state.
member.returns: The state.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorApduReceivedEventArgs.TryRespondAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Attempts to respond to an APDU.
member.param: A buffer containing the response.
member.returns: Returns an asynchronous operation that returns a boolean when the operation completes indicating. The boolean will be true if the operation was successful and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorApduReceivedEventArgs.TryRespondAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Attempts to respond to an APDU.
member.param: A buffer containing the response.
A reference containing the next state.
member.returns: Returns an asynchronous operation that returns a boolean when the operation completes. The boolean is true if the operation completed successfully and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorApduReceivedEventArgs.TryRespondWithCryptogramsAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,Windows.Foundation.Collections.IIterable{Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep})
member.summary: Attempts to respond to an APDU, placing cryptograms in the outgoing message as instructed by the placement steps.
member.param: A buffer containing a template response.
A collection that contains the cryptogram steps.
member.returns: Returns an asynchronous operation that completes with an operation status.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorApduReceivedEventArgs.TryRespondWithCryptogramsAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,Windows.Foundation.Collections.IIterable{Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Returns an asynchronous operation that completes with an operation status.
member.param: A buffer that contains a template response.
A collection that contains the cryptogram steps.
A reference that contains the next state.
member.returns: Returns an asynchronous operation that completes with an operation status.

member.summary: Gets the reason that the smart card connection to the NFC reader was deactivated.
member.returns: The reason that the smart card connection to the NFC reader was deactivated.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorConnectionDeactivatedReason
member.summary: Defines the reasons a smart card connection to an NFC reader could become deactivated.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorConnectionDeactivatedReason.ConnectionLost
member.summary: The physical connection to the reader was lost.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorConnectionDeactivatedReason.ConnectionRedirected
member.summary: The connection is redirected to another app due to reader terminal selecting a different application identifier which resolves to a different app.

member.summary: Provides information about a smart card emulator connection to an NFC reader.

member.summary: Gets the identifier for the connection.
member.returns: The identifier for the connection.

member.summary: Gets an enum value indicating if the connection is to an NFC reader or something else.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorConnectionSource
member.summary: Defines the valid types of smart card connection sources.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorConnectionSource.NfcReader
member.summary: Specifies an NFC reader connection.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorConnectionSource.Unknown
member.summary: Specifies a connection to something other than an NFC reader.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorEnablementPolicy
member.summary: Represents the current card emulation policy set by the user in the phone settings.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorEnablementPolicy.Always
member.summary: Card emulation is always on.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorEnablementPolicy.Never
member.summary: Card emulation is disabled.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorEnablementPolicy.ScreenOn
member.summary: Card emulation is only on when the phone screen is on.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorEnablementPolicy.ScreenUnlocked
member.summary: Card emulation is only on when the phone screen is unlocked.

member.summary: Defines the unlock prompting behavior.

member.summary: Allow an unlock prompt if required.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardUnlockPromptingBehavior.PreventUnlockPrompt
member.summary: Prevent an unlock prompt.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardUnlockPromptingBehavior.RequireUnlockPrompt
